{"step_by_step_thinking": "Kallmann syndrome is a genetic disorder where the primary symptom is a failure to start or a failure to complete puberty. It is also characterized by an impaired sense of smell. Infertility in Kallmann syndrome is due to hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, which results in low levels of the sex hormones that can lead to oligospermia, a condition of having too few sperm to fertilize an egg.", "answer_choice": "A. Oligospermia"}
